briefdescription.para: Calculates the absolute value of a number in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

detaileddescription.para: The absolute value is the positive version of value (example: |3-4| = 1).

parameterdescription.para: The number to use to determine the absolute value.

simplesect.para: The absolute value of num. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the absolute value of a number in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

detaileddescription.para: The absolute value is the positive version of value (example: |3-4| = 1).

parameterdescription.para: The number to use to determine the absolute value.

simplesect.para: The absolute value of num. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Allocates a buffer and copies a provided traditional string into the buffer.

parameterdescription.para: If non-null, to copy.

simplesect.para: A newly allocated buffer containing strToCopy.

briefdescription.para: Allocates a buffer and copies a provided traditional wide string into the buffer.

parameterdescription.para: If non-null, the wide string to copy.

simplesect.para: A newly allocated buffer containing wideStrToCopy.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcCos in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number in radians to calculate ArcCos for.

simplesect.para: The ArcCos of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs or numInRadians is not between -1 and 1, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcCos in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number in radians to calculate ArcCos for.

simplesect.para: The ArcCos of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs or numInRadians is not between -1 and 1, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcCosh in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number in radians to calculate ArcCosh for.

simplesect.para: The ArcCosh of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs or numInRadians is less than 1, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcCosh in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number in radians to calculate ArcCosh for.

simplesect.para: The ArcCosh of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs or numInRadians is less than 1, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcSin in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number in radians to calculate ArcSin for.

simplesect.para: The ArcSin of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs or numInRadians is less than or equal to -1 or numInRadians is greater then 1, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcSin in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number in radians to calculate ArcSin for.

simplesect.para: The ArcSin of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs or numInRadians is less than or equal to -1 or numInRadians is greater then 1, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcSinH in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number in radians to calculate ArcSinH for.

simplesect.para: The ArcSinH of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcSinH in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number in radians to calculate ArcSinH for.

simplesect.para: The ArcSinH of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcTan in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number in radians to calculate ArcTan for.

simplesect.para: The ArcTan of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcTan in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number in radians to calculate ArcTan for.

simplesect.para: The ArcTan of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcTanH in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number in radians to calculate ArcTanH for.

simplesect.para: The ArcTanH of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs or if numInRadians is less than or equal to -1 or if numInRadians is greater than or equal to 1, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcTanH in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number in radians to calculate ArcTanH for.

simplesect.para: The ArcTanH of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs or if numInRadians is less than or equal to -1 or if numInRadians is greater than or equal to 1, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcTan2 in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

detaileddescription.para: To compute the value, the function takes into account the sign of both arguments in order to determine the quadrant.

parameterdescription.para: Value representing the proportion of the y-coordinate.
Value representing the proportion of the x-coordinate.

simplesect.para: Arc Tangent of y/x, in radians. If y = 0 or x = 0, -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ArcTan2 in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

detaileddescription.para: To compute the value, the function takes into account the sign of both arguments in order to determine the quadrant.

parameterdescription.para: Value representing the proportion of the y-coordinate.
Value representing the proportion of the x-coordinate.

simplesect.para: Arc Tangent of y/x, in radians. If y = 0 or x = 0, -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Uses fseek() to calculate the size of the file by moving the file pointer to the end.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the File.

simplesect.para: Size of the file in bytes.

briefdescription.para: Gets the size of the file in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The full file path.

simplesect.para: Size of the file in bytes.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the smallest integer value greater than or equal to num.

parameterdescription.para: The number to convert.

simplesect.para: The smallest integral value not less than num.

parameterdescription.para: The number to convert.

simplesect.para: The smallest integral value not less than num.

briefdescription.para: Returns a single character in str at a specified index.

parameterdescription.para: String to search.
The (0 based) index of what character to get.

simplesect.para: A single character from str.

briefdescription.para: Returns a single character in str at a specified index.

parameterdescription.para: String to search.
The (0 based) index of what character to get.

simplesect.para: A single character from str.

parameterdescription.para: The starting point for the integral.

simplesect.para: The result of the Complementary Error Function integral. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the Complementary Error Function integral from num to infinity in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The starting point for the integral.

simplesect.para: The result of the Complementary Error Function integral. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Appends an array of strings together and returns the combined string.

parameterdescription.para: Number of strings to append.
The array of strings to append.

simplesect.para: A combined string of all the strings in the array.

briefdescription.para: Appends an array of strings together and returns the combined string.

parameterdescription.para: Number of strings to append.
The array of strings to append.

simplesect.para: A combined string of all the strings in the array.

briefdescription.para: Appends a vector array of strings together and returns the combined string.

parameterdescription.para: The vector array of strings to append.

simplesect.para: A combined string of all the strings in the array.

briefdescription.para: Appends a vector array of wide strings together and returns the combined wide string.

parameterdescription.para: The vector array of strings to append.

simplesect.para: A combined string of all the strings in the array.

briefdescription.para: Appends a series of strings together.

parameterdescription.para: Number of strings to append.
Variable arguments providing additional strings.

simplesect.para: A combined string of all the strings in the arguments.

briefdescription.para: Appends a series of strings together.

parameterdescription.para: Number of strings to append.
Variable arguments providing additional strings.

simplesect.para: A combined string of all the strings in the arguments.

briefdescription.para: Searches strToSearch for the first occurrence of strToLookFor and returns true if found.

parameterdescription.para: String to search starting from left to right.
String to look for inside of strToSearch.

simplesect.para: true if strToSearch contains strToLookFor, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Searches strToSearch for the first occurrence of strToLookFor and returns true if found.

parameterdescription.para: Wide String to search starting from left to right.
Wide String to look for inside of strToSearch.

simplesect.para: true if strToSearch contains strToLookFor, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Searches strToSearch for the first occurrence of strToLookFor (regardless of case) and returns true if found.

parameterdescription.para: String to search starting from left to right.
String to look for inside of strToSearch.

simplesect.para: true if strToSearch contains strToLookFor, >false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Searches strToSearch for the first occurrence of strToLookFor (regardless of case) and returns true if found.

parameterdescription.para: Wide String to search starting from left to right.
Wide String to look for inside of strToSearch.

simplesect.para: true if strToSearch contains strToLookFor, >false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: By definition, false is equal to 0 and true is equal to anything but 0.

detaileddescription.para: In other words, any positive or negative number returns true, if num is 0 then false.

parameterdescription.para: The number to determine if true or false.

simplesect.para: true or false based on the value of num.

briefdescription.para: Converts a traditional string array to a vector string array.

parameterdescription.para: The string array to convert.

simplesect.para: A string vector array.

briefdescription.para: Converts a traditional wide string array to a vector wide string array.

parameterdescription.para: The wide string array to convert.

simplesect.para: A wide string vector array.

briefdescription.para: Converts a given string to a bool, If str is a string like "False", "FALSE", or "tRuE", then the function will return false, false, true respectively.

detaileddescription.para: If str is an integer for example; "0" will return false and any other number will return true.

parameterdescription.para: String to convert.

simplesect.para: true if str is equal to "true" (any case combination) or if str is an integer not equal to 0; false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Converts a given wide string to a bool, If str is a wide string like "False", "FALSE", or "tRuE", then the function will return false, false, true respectively.

detaileddescription.para: If str is an integer for example; "0" will return false and any other number will return true.

parameterdescription.para: Wide String to convert.

simplesect.para: true if str is equal to "true" (any case combination) or if str is an integer not equal to 0; false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Converts a tokenized string (a string with commas separating numbers for example) to an array of floats.

parameterdescription.para: String to convert.
String that separates each number.
Size of the array.

simplesect.para: A newly allocated array of floats.

briefdescription.para: Converts a tokenized wide string (a string with commas separating numbers for example) to an array of floats.

parameterdescription.para: String to convert.
String that separates each number.
Size of the array.

simplesect.para: A newly allocated array of floats.

briefdescription.para: Converts a string to its hex value.

parameterdescription.para: String to convert to hex.

simplesect.para: The hex value of the string.

briefdescription.para: Converts a string to its hex value.

parameterdescription.para: String to convert to hex.

simplesect.para: The hex value of the string.

briefdescription.para: Converts a traditional string to a traditional string that is all on one line, In other words; this function removes any occurrence of from stringToConvert.

parameterdescription.para: The string to convert to one line.

simplesect.para: A string with every occurrence of removed.

briefdescription.para: Converts a traditional wide string to a traditional wide string that is all on one line, In other words; this function removes any occurrence of from stringToConvert.

parameterdescription.para: The wide string to convert to one line.

simplesect.para: A wide string with every occurrence of removed.

briefdescription.para: Converts a traditional string to a traditional string that is all on one line, In other words; this function removes any occurrence of from stringToConvert.

detaileddescription.para: strToConvert must be an allocated string since this function works directly on it.

parameterdescription.para: The string to directly convert to one line.

briefdescription.para: Converts a traditional wide string to a traditional wide string that is all on one line, In other words; this function removes any occurrence of from stringToConvert.

detaileddescription.para: strToConvert must be an allocated wide string since this function works directly on it.

parameterdescription.para: The wide string to directly convert to one line.

briefdescription.para: Converts a traditional string to a wide string.

detaileddescription.para: A wide string is a string containing Unicode characters (non English).

parameterdescription.para: The string to convert to a wide string.

simplesect.para: The result of the Error Function from 0 to num. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates e^x in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to raise e to (i.e. power = x in e^x).

simplesect.para: The result of raising e to power. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

parameterdescription.para: Number to raise e to (i.e. power = x in e^x).

simplesect.para: The result of raising e to power. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

simplesect.para: The result of raising e to power then subtracting 1. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

parameterdescription.para: Number to raise e to (i.e. power = x in e^x).

simplesect.para: The result of raising e to power then subtracting 1. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the largest integer value not greater than num.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The number to use to calculate.

simplesect.para: The largest integer value not greater than num. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the largest integer value not greater than num.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The number to use to calculate.

simplesect.para: The largest integer value not greater than num. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates The Gamma Function ( (0)integral(Inf)[t^num-1 * e^-t dt] ) in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use for t^num-1 in the equation.

simplesect.para: The result of calculating The Gamma Function for t^num-1. If a mathematical error occurs or if num is less than or equal to 0.0, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates The Gamma Function ( (0)integral(Inf)[t^num-1 * e^-t dt] ) in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use for t^num-1 in the equation.

simplesect.para: The result of calculating The Gamma Function for t^num-1. If a mathematical error occurs or if num is less than or equal to 0.0, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Some might think this is all unnecessary but I think it's important to seed the RandomNumberGenerator properly with a proper seed value.

detaileddescription.para: Too often are games plagued with predictable outcomes all leading back to not seeding the RNG properly. Generates a "super" random number using a random seed at launch.

parameterdescription.para: Lowest number to generate.
Highest number to generate.

simplesect.para: A random number between the given range.

briefdescription.para: Solves for c in Pythagoras theorem (a^2 + b^2 = c^2); i.e square root of (x^2 + y^2).

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Value of one of the sides of the triangle.
Value of the other side of the triangle.

simplesect.para: The Hypotenuse (the longest side) of the triangle. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Solves for c in Pythagoras theorem (a^2 + b^2 = c^2); i.e square root of (x^2 + y^2).

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Value of one of the sides of the triangle.
Value of the other side of the triangle.

simplesect.para: The Hypotenuse (the longest side) of the triangle. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

simplesect.para: The (0 based) index of where strToLookFor is located.

Wide String to look for inside of strToSearch.

simplesect.para: The (0 based) index of where strToLookFor is located.

briefdescription.para: Inserts the string strToInsert into strToRevcive by "sandwiching" the two halves of strToReceive.

detaileddescription.para: The first half is from 0 to startIndex-1, the last half is from startIndex to the end of strToReceive.

parameterdescription.para: The string to receive strToInsert.
The string to sandwich/insert into strToReceive.
The index in strToReceive to insert at strToInsert.

simplesect.para: The newly created string with strToInsert inserted into strToReceive.

briefdescription.para: Inserts the string strToInsert into strToRevcive by "sandwiching" the two halves of strToReceive.

detaileddescription.para: The first half is from 0 to startIndex-1, the last half is from startIndex to the end of strToReceive.

parameterdescription.para: The wide string to receive strToInsert.
The wide string to sandwich/insert into strToReceive.
The index in strToReceive to insert at strToInsert.

simplesect.para: The newly created wide string with strToInsert inserted into strToReceive.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if a character is a letter from either a to z or A to Z.

detaileddescription.para: Letters fall into a range on the ASCII chart which makes this an simple test.

parameterdescription.para: A single character to test if it's either a-z or A-Z.

simplesect.para: true if the character is between ranges a-z or A-Z; false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if a wide character is not a digit.

parameterdescription.para: A single wide character to test.

simplesect.para: true if the character is not a digit.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if a character is a digit from 0-9.

detaileddescription.para: Digits fall into a range on the ASCII chart which makes this an simple test.

parameterdescription.para: A single character to test if it's between 0-9.

simplesect.para: true if the character is between 0-9; false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if a wide character is a digit.

parameterdescription.para: A single wide character to test if it's between 0-9.

simplesect.para: true if the wide character is a digit; false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Searches a given string to see if it is all empty.

detaileddescription.para: In other words, is the string provided all whitespace.

parameterdescription.para: String to search.

simplesect.para: true if every character in str is whitespace; false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Searches a given wide string to see if it is all empty.

detaileddescription.para: In other words, is the string provided all whitespace.

parameterdescription.para: Wide String to search.

simplesect.para: true if every wide character in str is whitespace; false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if all characters are a digit.

parameterdescription.para: A string to test if all characters are digits.

simplesect.para: true if the string is all digits.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if all characters are a digit.

parameterdescription.para: A wide string to test if all characters are digits.

simplesect.para: true if the wide string is all digits.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the provided path leads to a device rather than a file.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The file path to test.

simplesect.para: true if the path leads to a device, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the provided path leads to a device rather than a file.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The file path to test.

simplesect.para: true if the path leads to a device, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if a character is whitespace.

parameterdescription.para: Character to test to see if it is whitespace.

simplesect.para: true if the character is a space, tab or newline; false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if a wide character is whitespace.

parameterdescription.para: Character to test to see if it is whitespace.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the logarithm (log) base 10 of num in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use to calculate its logarithm base 10.

simplesect.para: The logarithm base 10 of num. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use to calculate its logarithm base 10.

simplesect.para: The logarithm base 10 of num. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use to calculate its logarithm base 2.

simplesect.para: The logarithm base 2 of num. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Computes the floating-point remainder of the division operation numerator/denominator in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to be divided.
Number to divide the numerator by.

simplesect.para: The remainder of the division operation. If a mathematical error occurs or if denominator equals 0, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Computes the floating-point remainder of the division operation numerator/denominator in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to be divided.
Number to divide the numerator by.

simplesect.para: The remainder of the division operation. If a mathematical error occurs or if denominator equals 0, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the product of multOne * multTwo, then adds add to that product (i.e.

detaileddescription.para: (multOne * multTwo) + add). Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to multiply.
Other number to multiply.
Number to add to the product of multOne * multTwo.

simplesect.para: The result of (multOne * multTwo) + add. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the product of multOne * multTwo, then adds add to that product (i.e.

detaileddescription.para: (multOne * multTwo) + add). Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to multiply.
Other number to multiply.
Number to add to the product of multOne * multTwo.

simplesect.para: The result of (multOne * multTwo) + add. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the Natural Logarithm (ln) of num in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use to calculate its Natural Logarithm.

simplesect.para: The Natural Logarithm of num. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the Natural Logarithm (ln) of num in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use to calculate its Natural Logarithm.

simplesect.para: The Natural Logarithm of num. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates The Natural Log (ln) of The Gamma Function (ln | (0)integral(Inf)[t^num-1 * e^-t dt] |).

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use for t^num-1 in the equation.

simplesect.para: The result of calculating The Gamma Function for t^num-1. If a mathematical error occurs or if num is less than or equal to 0.0, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates The Natural Log (ln) of The Gamma Function (ln | (0)integral(Inf)[t^num-1 * e^-t dt] |).

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use for t^num-1 in the equation.

simplesect.para: The result of calculating The Gamma Function for t^num-1. If a mathematical error occurs or if num is less than or equal to 0.0, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the first occurrence of charToLookFor in strToSearch starting at startIndex onward.

parameterdescription.para: String to search through.
Character to look for in strToSearch.
Index to start looking.

simplesect.para: The index of the first occurrence of charToLookFor starting from startIndex. If not found, -1 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the first occurrence of charToLookFor in strToSearch starting at startIndex onward.

Wide Character to look for in strToSearch.
Index to start looking.

simplesect.para: The index of the first occurrence of strToLookFor starting from startIndex. If not found, -1 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates num * 2^power in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to multiply 2^power by.
Number to raise 2 to.

simplesect.para: The result of num * 2^power. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates num * 2^power in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to multiply 2^power by.
Number to raise 2 to.

simplesect.para: The result of num * 2^power. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Takes the provided base and raises it to the exponent (power).

parameterdescription.para: Number to raise.
Number of times to multiply base by itself.

simplesect.para: The base raised to the exponent is returned. If a mathematical error occurs or base is 0.0 and exponent is less than or equal to 0.0 OR base is negative, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Takes the provided base and raises it to the exponent (power).

parameterdescription.para: Number to raise.
Number of times to multiply base by itself.

simplesect.para: The base raised to the exponent is returned. If a mathematical error occurs or base is 0.0 and exponent is less than or equal to 0.0 OR base is negative, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the difference between numOne and numTwo only if numOne > numTwo.

detaileddescription.para: If numOne <= numTwo then 0 is returned. Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use for subtraction.
Other number to use for subtraction.

simplesect.para: If numOne is larger then numTwo; then numOne - numTwo is returned, else 0 is returned. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the difference between numOne and numTwo only if numOne > numTwo.

detaileddescription.para: If numOne <= numTwo then 0 is returned. Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use for subtraction.
Other number to use for subtraction.

simplesect.para: If numOne is larger then numTwo; then numOne - numTwo is returned, else 0 is returned. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Converts a number from radians to degrees.

parameterdescription.para: Radians to convert.

simplesect.para: Degrees.

briefdescription.para: Converts a number from radians to degrees.

parameterdescription.para: Radians to convert.

simplesect.para: Degrees.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the Computes The IEEE remainder of the floating point division operation numerator/denominator.

detaileddescription.para: In contrast to Mod(); the returned value is not guaranteed to have the same sign as the numerator. Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to be divided.
Number to divide the numerator by.

simplesect.para: The IEEE remainder of the floating point division. If a mathematical error occurs or denominator equals 0, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the Computes The IEEE remainder of the floating point division operation numerator/denominator.

detaileddescription.para: In contrast to Mod(); the returned value is not guaranteed to have the same sign as the numerator. Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to be divided.
Number to divide the numerator by.

simplesect.para: The IEEE remainder of the floating point division. If a mathematical error occurs or denominator equals 0, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the floating-point remainder of the division operation numerator/denominator the same way the Remainder() function does.

detaileddescription.para: Additionally, the sign and at least the three of the last bits of numerator/denominator will be stored in outQuadrant, sufficient to determine the quadrant of the result within a period. Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to be divided.
Number to divide the numerator by.
Sign to indicate the quadrant.

simplesect.para: The IEEE remainder of the floating point division and the quadrant data. If a mathematical error occurs or denominator equals 0, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the floating-point remainder of the division operation numerator/denominator the same way the Remainder() function does.

detaileddescription.para: Additionally, the sign and at least the three of the last bits of numerator/denominator will be stored in outQuadrant, sufficient to determine the quadrant of the result within a period. Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to be divided.
Number to divide the numerator by.
Sign to indicate the quadrant.

simplesect.para: The IEEE remainder of the floating point division and the quadrant data. If a mathematical error occurs or denominator equals 0, then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Removes all whitespace from a given string.

detaileddescription.para: A newly allocated string is returned that has all whitespace removed from it.

parameterdescription.para: The string to remove whitespace from.

simplesect.para: A newly created string containing no whitespace.

briefdescription.para: Removes all whitespace from a given wide string.

detaileddescription.para: A newly allocated string is returned that has all whitespace removed from it.

parameterdescription.para: The string to remove whitespace from.

simplesect.para: A newly created string containing no whitespace.

briefdescription.para: Removes all whitespace from a given string in place.

detaileddescription.para: This means That str is modified directly and as a result, no return value is needed. Assumes str is an allocated string and not a string literal.

parameterdescription.para: The string to directly modify and delete whitespace from.

briefdescription.para: Removes all whitespace from a given wide string in place.

detaileddescription.para: This means That str is modified directly and as a result, no return value is needed. Assumes str is an allocated string and not a string literal.

parameterdescription.para: The wide string to directly modify and delete whitespace from.

briefdescription.para: Removes any occurrence of charToRemove from strToRemoveFrom.

parameterdescription.para: If non-null, to remove from.
The character to remove.

simplesect.para: A newly created string with every occurrence of charToRemove removed.

briefdescription.para: Removes any occurrence of charToRemove from strToRemoveFrom.

parameterdescription.para: If non-null, to remove from.
The character to remove.

simplesect.para: A newly created string with every occurrence of charToRemove removed.

briefdescription.para: Removes any occurrence of charToRemove from strToRemoveFrom.

detaileddescription.para: strToRemoveFrom must be an allocated string since this function works directly on it.

parameterdescription.para: If non-null, to remove from.
The character to remove.

briefdescription.para: Removes any occurrence of charToRemove from strToRemoveFrom.

detaileddescription.para: strToRemoveFrom must be an allocated string since this function works directly on it.

parameterdescription.para: If non-null, to remove from.
The character to remove.

briefdescription.para: Inserts strToReplaceWith in the position strToLookFor is located, then strToLookFor is removed.

detaileddescription.para: A newly allocated string is then returned.

parameterdescription.para: The string to look through.
The substring to look for.
The substring to replace with.

simplesect.para: A newly created string with the change.

briefdescription.para: Inserts strToReplaceWith in the position strToLookFor is located, then strToLookFor is removed.

detaileddescription.para: A newly allocated wide string is then returned.

parameterdescription.para: The wide string to look through.
The substring to look for.
The substring to replace with.

simplesect.para: A newly created wide string with the change.

briefdescription.para: Directly modifies and inserts strToReplaceWith in the position strToLookFor is located, then strToLookFor is removed.

detaileddescription.para: Since strToSearch is modified directly, there is no return value. data is re-allocated in order to hold the replacement string.

parameterdescription.para: The string to directly parse and modify.
The substring to look for.
The substring to replace with.

briefdescription.para: Directly modifies and inserts strToReplaceWith in the position strToLookFor is located, then strToLookFor is removed.

detaileddescription.para: Since strToSearch is modified directly, there is no return value. data is re-allocated in order to hold the replacement wide string.

parameterdescription.para: The wide string to directly parse and modify.
The substring to look for.
The substring to replace with.

briefdescription.para: Finds the XML data between the startTag and endTag and returns it.

parameterdescription.para: A string containing the data to be parsed.
A string representing the tag to start from.
A string representing the tag to end on.

simplesect.para: A Buffer containing the data between startTag + startTag.length() and endTag.

briefdescription.para: Finds the XML data between the startTag and endTag and returns it.

parameterdescription.para: A string containing the data to be parsed.
A string representing the tag to start from.
A string representing the tag to end on.

simplesect.para: A Buffer containing the data between startTag + startTag.length() and endTag.

briefdescription.para: Finds the XML data between the startTagIndex and endTagIndex and returns it.

parameterdescription.para: A string containing the data to be parsed.
Index of where to start reading in.
Index of where to end reading data.

simplesect.para: A Buffer containing the data between startTagIndex and endTagIndex.

briefdescription.para: Finds the XML data between the startTagIndex and endTagIndex and returns it.

parameterdescription.para: A wide string containing the data to be parsed.
Index of where to start reading in.
Index of where to end reading data.

simplesect.para: A Buffer containing the data between startTagIndex and endTagIndex.

briefdescription.para: Finds a series of XML data between startTag and endTag.

detaileddescription.para: For example, if we were reading in an XML file that looked like this: <Models> <Model> <position>0.1, 2.3, 2.2</position> <rotation>20.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0</rotation> </Model> <Model> <position>3.0, 4.0, 5.0</position> <rotation>0.0, 30.0, 0.0, 1.0</rotation> </Model> </Models>

And the start and end tags were "<Model>" and "</Model>" respectively; then the function will return an array containing: Array[0]="<position>0.1, 2.3, 2.2</position> <rotation>20.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0</rotation>"

parameterdescription.para: A string containing the data to be parsed.
A string representing the tag to start from.
A string representing the tag to end on.
Size of the out final buffer.

simplesect.para: A newly allocated string array containing the data between each startTag and endTag found.

briefdescription.para: Finds a series of XML data between startTag and endTag.

detaileddescription.para: For example, if we were reading in an XML file that looked like this: <Models> <Model> <position>0.1, 2.3, 2.2</position> <rotation>20.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0</rotation> </Model> <Model> <position>3.0, 4.0, 5.0</position> <rotation>0.0, 30.0, 0.0, 1.0</rotation> </Model> </Models>

And the start and end tags were "<Model>" and "</Model>" respectively; then the function will return an array containing: Array[0]="<position>0.1, 2.3, 2.2</position> <rotation>20.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0</rotation>"

parameterdescription.para: A wide string containing the data to be parsed.
A wide string representing the tag to start from.
A wide string representing the tag to end on.
Size of the out final buffer.

simplesect.para: A newly allocated wide string array containing the data between each startTag and endTag found.

memberdef.argsstring: (char *filePath, size_t numBytesToRead=0, size_t maxBufferSize=MAX_STRING_BUFFER_SIZE, const char *mode="r", int seekOffset=0, int seekOrigin=SEEK_SET, long *outEndCursorPos=NULL)
memberdef.name: ReadTextFile

briefdescription.para: Opens a file for reading and returns a char buffer containing some or all of the data in the file.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with the CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the file.
The size of the buffer (the number bytes read in). If 0; numBytesToRead = maxBufferSize.
Maximum number of bytes to read.
The mode for fopen_s ("r" for read, "r+" for read/write, etc).
Either zero, or a value returned by ftell().
Position used as reference for the offset (SEEK_SET represents beginning of file).
The value returned by ftell() after doing the read.

simplesect.para: The buffer containing the file data of size numBytesToRead.

memberdef.argsstring: (wchar_t *filePath, size_t numBytesToRead=0, size_t maxBufferSize=MAX_STRING_BUFFER_SIZE, const wchar_t *mode=L"r, ccs=UTF-8", int seekOffset=0, int seekOrigin=SEEK_SET, long *outEndCursorPos=NULL)
memberdef.name: ReadTextFileW

briefdescription.para: Opens a file for reading and returns a wide char buffer containing some or all of the data in the file.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with the CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the file.
The size of the buffer (the number bytes read in). If 0; numBytesToRead = maxBufferSize.
Maximum number of bytes to read.
The mode for fopen_s ("r" for read, "r, ccs=UTF-8" for read unicode, "r+" for read/write, etc).
Either zero, or a value returned by ftell().
Position used as reference for the offset (SEEK_SET represents beginning of file).
The value returned by ftell() after doing the read.

simplesect.para: The buffer containing the file data of size numBytesToRead.

memberdef.argsstring: (char *filePath, size_t numBytesToRead=0, size_t maxBufferSize=MAX_STRING_BUFFER_SIZE, const char *mode="rb", int seekOffset=0, int seekOrigin=SEEK_SET, long *outEndCursorPos=NULL)
memberdef.name: ReadBinaryFile

briefdescription.para: Opens a file for reading and returns a char buffer containing some or all of the data in the file.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with the CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the file.
The size of the buffer (the number bytes read in). If 0; numBytesToRead = maxBufferSize.
Maximum number of bytes to read.
The mode for fopen_s ("r" for read, "r+" for read/write, etc).
Number of bytes to offset from origin.
Position used as reference for the offset (SEEK_SET represents beginning of file).
The value returned by ftell() after doing the read.

simplesect.para: The buffer containing the file data of size numBytesToRead.

memberdef.argsstring: (wchar_t *filePath, size_t numBytesToRead=0, size_t maxBufferSize=MAX_STRING_BUFFER_SIZE, const wchar_t *mode=L"rb, ccs=UTF-8", int seekOffset=0, int seekOrigin=SEEK_SET, long *outEndCursorPos=NULL)
memberdef.name: ReadBinaryFileW

briefdescription.para: Opens a file for reading and returns a wide char buffer containing some or all of the data in the file.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with the CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the file.
The size of the buffer (the number bytes read in). If 0; numBytesToRead = maxBufferSize.
Maximum number of bytes to read.
The mode for fopen_s ("r" for read, "r, ccs=UTF-8" for read unicode, "r+" for read/write, etc).
Number of bytes to offset from origin.
Position used as reference for the offset (SEEK_SET represents beginning of file).
The value returned by ftell() after doing the read.

simplesect.para: The buffer containing the file data of size numBytesToRead.

briefdescription.para: Rounds the floating-point argument num to an integer value, using the current rounding mode.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

simplesect.para: The num rounded using the current rounding mode. If a mathematical error occurs then -1 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Rounds the floating-point argument num to an integer value, using the current rounding mode.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to round.

simplesect.para: The num rounded using the current rounding mode. If a mathematical error occurs then -1 is returned.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to round.

simplesect.para: The nearest integer value to num, rounding halfway cases away from zero. If a mathematical error occurs then -1 is returned.

parameterdescription.para: Number in radians to calculate SinH for.

simplesect.para: The SinH of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

detaileddescription.para: If the number provided is negative, -1 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns the Square Root of the provided number.

detaileddescription.para: If the number provided is negative, -1 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns a string containing the characters between startIndex and upToButNotIncludingIndex.

detaileddescription.para: Unlike strstr(), this function creates a new string and returns it. If upToButNotIncludingIndex is not provided, then the string returned is everything from startIndex to the end of the string.
Here's an example: str = "Happiness" startIndex = 3 upToButNotIncludingIndex = 8 then the output would be "pines".

parameterdescription.para: The string to parse.
The (0 based) index of where to start parsing str.
The (0 based) index of where to stop.

simplesect.para: A newly created string containing the characters from startIndex to upToButNotIncludingIndex.

briefdescription.para: Returns a wide string containing the characters between startIndex and upToButNotIncludingIndex.

detaileddescription.para: Unlike strstr(), this function creates a new string and returns it. If upToButNotIncludingIndex is not provided, then the string returned is everything from startIndex to the end of the string.
Here's an example: str = "Happiness" startIndex = 3 upToButNotIncludingIndex = 8 then the output would be "pines".

parameterdescription.para: The wide string to parse.
The (0 based) index of where to start parsing str.
The (0 based) index of where to stop.

simplesect.para: A newly created wide string containing the characters from startIndex to upToButNotIncludingIndex.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the Tangent (Tan) of numInRadians in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use to calculate its tangent.

simplesect.para: The Tangent (tan) of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the Tangent (Tan) of numInRadians in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use to calculate its tangent.

simplesect.para: The Tangent (tan) of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates The Hyperbolic Tangent (TanH) of numInRadians in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use to calculate its hyperbolic tangent.

simplesect.para: The Hyperbolic Tangent (tan) of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates The Hyperbolic Tangent (TanH) of numInRadians in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to use to calculate its hyperbolic tangent.

simplesect.para: The Hyperbolic Tangent (tan) of numInRadians. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Breaks up a string and returns an array of all the strings between each delimiter.

detaileddescription.para: For example: "Shit,Piss, Cunt,Cock-sucker,Mother_Fucker,and tits" And the delimiter was "," then the function would return: Array[0] = "Shit" Array[1] = "Piss" Array[2] = " Cunt" Array[3] = "Cock-sucker" Array[4] = "Mother_Fucker" Array[5] = "and tits".

parameterdescription.para: A string to break up into an array.
A string/character used to separate each string in strToTokenize.
Number of strings added to the final array.

simplesect.para: An array of strings broken up from strToTokenize.

briefdescription.para: Breaks up a wide string and returns an array of all the wide strings between each delimiter.

detaileddescription.para: For example: "Shit,Piss, Cunt,Cock-sucker,Mother_Fucker,and tits" And the delimiter was "," then the function would return: Array[0] = "Shit" Array[1] = "Piss" Array[2] = " Cunt" Array[3] = "Cock-sucker" Array[4] = "Mother_Fucker" Array[5] = "and tits".

parameterdescription.para: A wide string to break up into an array.
A wide string/character used to separate each wide string in strToTokenize.
Number of wide strings added to the final array.

simplesect.para: An array of strings broken up from strToTokenize.

briefdescription.para: Removes everything after the decimal point.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to truncate.

simplesect.para: The truncated version of num. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Removes everything after the decimal point.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to truncate.

simplesect.para: The truncated version of num. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates 2^power in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to raise 2 to.

simplesect.para: The value of 2^power. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Calculates 2^power in compliance with CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: Number to raise 2 to.

simplesect.para: The value of 2^power. If a mathematical error occurs then -1.0 is returned.

memberdef.argsstring: (char *filePath, char *bufferToWrite, size_t bufferSize, const char *mode="w", int seekOffset=0, int seekOrigin=SEEK_SET, long *outEndCursorPos=NULL)
memberdef.name: WriteTextFile

briefdescription.para: Opens a file for writing and returns the number of items/elements written to the file.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with the CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the file.
The data to be written.
Size of the buffer in bytes.
The mode for fopen_s ("w" for write, "w+" for read/write, etc).
Either zero, or a value returned by ftell().
Position used as reference for the offset (SEEK_SET represents beginning of file).
The value returned by ftell() after doing the read.

simplesect.para: The number of items/elements written to the file.

memberdef.argsstring: (wchar_t *filePath, wchar_t *bufferToWrite, size_t bufferSize, const wchar_t *mode=L"w, ccs=UTF-8", int seekOffset=0, int seekOrigin=SEEK_SET, long *outEndCursorPos=NULL)
memberdef.name: WriteTextFileW

briefdescription.para: Opens a file for writing and returns the number of items/elements written to the file.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with the CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the file.
The data to be written.
Size of the buffer in bytes.
The mode for fopen_s ("w" for write, "w+" for read/write, etc).
Either zero, or a value returned by ftell().
Position used as reference for the offset (SEEK_SET represents beginning of file).
The value returned by ftell() after doing the read.

simplesect.para: The number of items/elements written to the file.

memberdef.name: WriteBinaryFile

briefdescription.para: Opens a file for writing and returns the number of items/elements written to the file.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with the CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the file.
The data to be written.
Maximum number of bytes to read.
The mode for fopen_s ("w" for write, "w+" for read/write, etc).
Number of bytes to offset from origin.
Position used as reference for the offset (SEEK_SET represents beginning of file).
The value returned by ftell() after doing the read.

simplesect.para: The buffer containing the file data of size numBytesToRead.

memberdef.argsstring: (wchar_t *filePath, wchar_t *bufferToWrite, size_t bufferSize, const wchar_t *mode=L"wb, ccs=UTF-8", int seekOffset=0, int seekOrigin=SEEK_SET, long *outEndCursorPos=NULL)
memberdef.name: WriteBinaryFileW

briefdescription.para: Opens a file for writing and returns the number of items/elements written to the file.

detaileddescription.para: Created in compliance with the CERT Coding Standard.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the file.
The data to be written.
Maximum number of bytes to read.
The mode for fopen_s ("w" for write, "w+" for read/write, etc).
Number of bytes to offset from origin.
Position used as reference for the offset (SEEK_SET represents beginning of file).
The value returned by ftell() after doing the read.

simplesect.para: The buffer containing the file data of size numBytesToRead.
